summary:
1.	Personal Profile:

I ‘m a multidisciplinary expert ,a very flexible person and hard worker with a good communication skills: ready to work effectively in a team with ability to meet the deadline. I’ m a people person and am looking for a new challenge where I can use my existing and further develop my career.
I am a fast learner and I enjoy closely following the latest changes in technology as I seek to apply this to my duties wherever relevant. I see myself as a positive team motivator and leader and I have the ability to guide and work with others.

2. Key achievements:

- I’m very involved with the day to day management of all aspects of company’s restructuring program. I was required to analyse the strength of the frequency of TV and radio signal during the transmission from the TV station to others channels.
- I ‘m able to write a script for news report in a professional way and present it into two international languages: French and English.
- I ‘m able to create a script scenario for documentary movie direct it  and edit it using adobe premiere pro and other professional editing programs.
-Co-founder and presenter of thousand hills of Rwanda; a tourism show broadcasted at Lemigo TV (known nowadays as Royal TV) and others local media.
-Co-founder of Andres media industry Ltd, a local media  known for its freelance products of advertisements, authentic news report and others documentaries to the local media within the country.
- I ‘m an expert in  communication for innovation with a high capacity of exploring the products produced by a company  in the aspect a responsible innovation by analysing stakeholders’ interests and needs, trough outline interventions and study strategies that facilitate communication, innovation and knowledge sharing.

profile_positions.title: Assistant lecturer:Social media and online marketing

profile_positions.description:
Identify target audience and key objective of the production.
-Develop a realistic production schedule with a clear order and timeline indicating when elements of the project are to be achieved. Work backwards from the final broadcast date.
-Estimate budget for production and seek necessary funding. Explore funding opportunities, e.g. government, private sector investors, etc.
-Assess and plan for equipment, the people, time required and resources necessary. Engage required people including: camera and audio operators, writer/s, reporters, production assistants, producer, editor, etc.
-Determine how the final production will be distributed to the target audience. You may have to sign a pre-sale agreement.
profile_positions.title: Founder/Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
TV presenter of a tourism show called thousand hills of Rwanda.
-	Work closely with the producer and the studio production/broadcast crew.
-	Read the introductions to stories and conduct interviews which may be live or recorded, usually in a studio. Work with the reporter or scriptwriter to ensure the language used in the script is compatible with your style of reading. Research the story and better understand it by talking to the producer and reporter.
-	Appearing in front of the camera, pay special attention to your appearance and voice.
-	Read and rehearse the words to be spoken to camera. Talks to the reporter, writer, or producer about difficult words, e.g. last names and place names
profile_positions.title: TV presenter

company.name: Rwanda Broadcasting Agency (specifically on Rwanda Television i.e. RTV -January 2010- November 2012

profile_positions.description:
--assembling, preparing and setting up equipment prior to filming, which  include tripods, monitors, lighting, cables and leads and headphones.
-working as part of a team of camera operators filming live events, such as sporting and ceremonial occasions and music performances.
profile_positions.title: Camera operator

profile_positions.description:
-Identify audience information needs. Research news stories and identify people central to the story to interview. Plan the logistics of getting the required elements of the report. Plan to meet required program deadline/s.
-Employ appropriate questioning techniques to maximise interview outcomes.
-Take all images needed for the news.
-Identify the strongest news angles and emphasise these in the news readers’ introduction and/or the first paragraphs of the script. 
-Plan how the elements in the report can fit together and where the best grabs and vision will go.
-Record voice-over
-Editing the report using the script as a plan.
profile_positions.title: TV news Reporter
